5.8.2 Protection of web services and applications

Where the information requires access control, it shall be ensured that 
the information cannot be accessed without authentication, in particular by taking action 
on the following aspects:  
a) The server shall be prevented from providing access to documents by 
alternative means to the given protocol.
Privilege escalation attempts shall be prevented.

Cross site scripting attacks shall be prevented.  
Reinforcement R1 -Security audit's.

Rules of use shall be established, defining the use that is authorized and 
limitations on personal use. In particular, the permitted use of encrypted connections shall 
be specified.

Hygiene awareness activities in web browsing shall be carried out on a 
regular basis,  promoting safe use and warning of misuse.

System administrator(s) shall be trained in service monitoring and 
incident response.
Web address resolution and connection information shall be protected.

The organization in general and the workstation in particular shall be 
protected from problems occurring via web navigation.

It shall protect against the action of harmful programs such as active 
pages, executable code downloads, etc., preventing the system from being exposed to 
attack vectors such as spyware, ransomware, etc.

An executive cookie control policy shall be established, in particular, to 
avoid contamination between personal use and organizational use.  
Reinforcement R1  Monitoring.

Technologies shall be deployed to prevent known attacks.  
Reinforcement R1 -Detection and reaction.
